text: Tagetes elongata is a Latin American species of marigolds in the sunflower family. It has been found in central and southern Mexico from San Luis Potosí and Zacatecas south to Chiapas.Strother, J. L. 1999. Compositae–Heliantheae s. l. 5: 1–232. In D.E. Breedlove (ed.) Flora of Chiapas. California Academy of Sciences, San Francisco Tagetes elongata is an annual herb up to 60 cm (2 feet) tall. Leaves are pinnately compound with 9-17 toothed leaflets. The plant produces numerous flower heads in flat-topped arrays, yellow, each head containing ray florets surrounding disc florets.Rydberg, Per Axel 1913. in Britton, Nathaniel Lord, North American Flora 34: 153-154 ==References== ==External links== elongata Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Plants described in 1803 Category:Taxa named by Carl Ludwig Willdenow
title: Tagetes elongata
